sense.name: act, engage in, undertake, execute, cause, make
sense.commentary: Includes: DO DRUGS, DO IT (meaning to have sex), DO THE DISHES, DO THE HONORS, DO WORK, DO ONE'S BEST, DO RIGHT BY
sense.examples: She does research in early child development. I did the washing and my sister did the cooking. Just do your job. Who did the damage to your car? Her husband does law. He did drugs in college. I'd like to do the dining room in apricot. Don't do me like that! She hates the way he did her hair. I can't believe Amanda and Martin did it! Martin did Amanda behind the school. Can you please do the dishes after dinner? 'Father, will you do the honors of cutting the turkey?' I never did any work in that class! The architect did his best on the building, but it wasn't enough to keep it from collapsing. Do right by those you love.

sense.name: fare, get along
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 DO ADVP Note: no Direct Object
sense.examples: How are you doing these days? He's doing great as our new CTO.

sense.name: suffice or satisfy
sense.commentary: Includes: DO (ONE) GOOD, DO WELL Syntax Is: NP1 AUX DO
sense.examples: A simple 'thank you' will do. This arrangement of the furniture just won't do. A good nap will do you good. You will do well to arrive on time to the ball.

sense.name: serve time (usually in prison)
sense.examples: He did ten years in San Quentin. She did two years in the Peace Corps before college.

sense.name: manage, carry on
sense.commentary: Note: occurs with modal, e.g. COULD, MAY HAVE TO
sense.examples: We may do without running water next week. This class could have done with a bit more studying and less talking.

sense.name: travel or go
sense.examples: The soldiers did 20 miles a day over the rough terrain. This old car will probably not do over 60 miles per hour. We did Paris in a day.

sense.name: destroy, damage or eliminate
sense.commentary: Includes: DO IN, DO AWAY WITH, DO A JOB ON
sense.examples: 'I gotta do in Marty for the boss.' Do away with these ugly curtains! That dog sure did a job on your face.

sense.name: DO UP: make pretty, make up
sense.examples: The clerk did up the package with a big pink bow. She did herself up for her blind date.
